main event: A large, bright, fiery ball flying object was observed traveling from 220 degrees to 330 degrees, emitting vapor clouds with a curved track. The sighting was witnessed by officers of the U.S.S. Boston and lasted about three minutes.
interesting points: The sighting involved a large, bright, fiery ball with a curved track and vapor clouds, which is unusual for conventional aircraft or natural phenomena.
The duration of the sighting was about three minutes, allowing for a detailed observation by the witnesses.
The report was initially logged on April 22nd, 1959, and later determined to be a significant discovery.
Lt. Hamilton issued a memo routing slip to relay the report for evaluation, emphasizing that the observed object was not a satellite.
The sighting involved credible witnesses - officers of the U.S.S. Boston - adding to the credibility of the observation.
sighted object: large, bright, fiery ball flying object emitting vapor clouds with a curved track
location: Ocean, standing of which 28 Ct 33 Broadway NYC
